lines.content: _Duke_ is an application designed for managing to-do lists, optimized for use via a __Command Line Interface (CLI)__.
What can I do for you?
Adds a deadline to the list with the date by which the deadline is due.
Adds an event and when it's happening to the list.
Adds a todo task with a description with no other information required.
### Delete an item from the list
Deletes a task from the main list.
List all items present in the list on the screen, while indicating what kind of task it is, whether it is done or not and any other information attached to the specific kind of task.
### Search for items in the list
Searches for tasks that match the search string, and displays.
Indicates that the task is done and reflects it when the tasks are printed on screen.
### Re-mark an item as not done yet
Un-marks the task and indicates it as not done again.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
The output message shows that the task is added, and prints out the number of tasks that are now present in the list.
Takes a deadline's description and the due date in `yyyy-mm-dd` format, and adds the deadline to the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
The output shows that the deadline is added, and prints out the number of tasks that are now present in the list.
Takes an event's description and when the event is taking place using the `/at` keyword, and adds the event to the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
The output shows that the event is added, and prints out the number of tasks that are now present in the list.
The output shows all the tasks currently in the program, and shows the kind of task it is and whether it is done or not.
- `[X]` indicates done and `[ ]` indicates not done.
- `[D]` indicates that the task is a deadline, `[E]` indicates events, and `[T]` indicates to-do tasks
Marks a task using the task number.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
The output shows that the task is marked as done and indicates it when the task is printed.
### `umark` - unmark a task as not done yet
Un-marks a task using the task number.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
The output shows that the task is marked as done and indicates it when the task is printed.
Deletes a task using the task number.
Got it. I've removed this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
The output shows that the task is removed from the list and indicates the remaining number of tasks.
Searches inside the list by looking for the search string in the descriptions of all tasks.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
* Runs the main duke program using the Runner class.
* @param args arguments to run the program, can be left empty
* @throws IOException exception could be thrown if reading or writing from a file is not successful
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Provides methods for storing to and loading from the storage file.
* Reads all the existing tasks from a text file and adds them to the TaskList.
* @throws FileNotFoundException exception if the file does not exist
private static void readFromFile() throws FileNotFoundException {
File f = new File(Duke.FILE_NAME); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Saves the entire TaskList to the given text file/
* @throws IOException exception if file cannot be written to
public static void saveToFile() throws IOException {
* Tries to read from file and prints a message if the file does not exist.
* Parses a string to a Task object by figuring out the kind of Task,
* and all other fields required for the relevant class.
* @param line the string that needs to be parsed as a Task
* @return Task the task object which can be added to the TaskList
* Appropriately converts a Task to a string object in a way that all
* information about the Task object is preserved. Every field of the
* object is converted to a string and the final line is constructed.
* @param task the Task object which needs to be converted to string
* @return the string that can be written to a text file as a single line
* @param b the boolean value to be turned either to 0 or 1
* Each line that the user inputs is parsed and processed.
* @param line the line from the command line that needs to be parsed in order
*             for appropriate action to be taken
* @throws DukeIllegalKeyword throws exception if invalid keyword is typed
* @throws DukeIllegalDescription throws exception if no description is added
static void processLine(String line) throws DukeIllegalKeyword, DukeIllegalDescription {
* Loads previous data from file and starts requesting input from user.
* Loads previous tasks from file and starts requesting input and processing it
* line by line until the user inputs "bye".
* @throws IOException exception in case file access if unsuccessful
public static void run() throws IOException {
* Class used to search for a keyword inside the list of tasks.
* This method prints out any task whose description contains
* the keyword we are looking for.
* @param keyWord the string user searched for
System.out.print("\t Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* The main list where all the tasks are stored while the program is running.
* The main UI which helps print relevant output.
* When user requests to mark a task, this method not only marks the
* task as done, but also prints out the relevant message.
* @param index the index of the task to mark
"\t Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" +
* Marks a task as not done and prints out the relevant message as
* @param index the index of the task to unmark
"\tOK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" +
* Pretty prints the recently added task with a message confimation.
* @param task the task which was just added to the TaskList
"\t Got it. I've added this task:" + "\n" +
* Pretty prints the recently deleted task which confirms deletion.
"\t Got it. I've removed this task:" + "\n" +
* Prints out all tasks in the TaskList when the user requests to view
* Prints out an error message when the DukeIllegalKeyword exception is thrown.
"\t I have no idea what you are trying to say. :(" + "\n" +
* Prints out an error message when the DukeIllegalDescription exception is thrown.
"\t You did not add any description." + "\n" +
"\t I can't do much. Try again!" + "\n" +
* Prints out an error message when the command cannot be parsed and *any*
"\t You did not make any sense" + "\n" +
"\t I can't do much. Try again!" + "\n" +
"\t What can I do for you?\n" +
"\t Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n" +
